detaileddescription.para: This navigation class constructor sets up our robot to begin navigating a particular map

parameterdescription.para: An EV3LargeRegularedMotor object instance that allows control of the left motor
An EV3LargeRegularedMotor object instance that allows control of the right motor

detaileddescription.para: This method sets the motor acceleration speed to a lower threshold value
This method calculates the angle necessary for the robot to rotate to face a certain point

parameterdescription.para: The x coordinate of the point to face
The y coordinate of the point to face

detaileddescription.para: This method makes our robot travel to a point by first rotating it and then traversing to the point

parameterdescription.para: The x coordinate of the point to travel to
The y coordinate of the point to travel to

detaileddescription.para: This method makes the robot travel to a desired position by checking its orientation and corrects it if necessary to align with the lines on the grid.

parameterdescription.para: The x coordinate to travel to
The y coordinate to travel to
This boolean decides if the robot will pay attention to readings from the ultrasonic sensor to avoid obstacles when navigating

detaileddescription.para: This method moves our robot a certain distance with corrections if required.

parameterdescription.para: The distance our robot is to travel
The angle to be corrected to upon crossing a tile

detaileddescription.para: This method moves the robot one tile until it detects a black line

parameterdescription.para: The angle to be corrected to upon crossing a tile

detaileddescription.para: This method turns our robot to a desired angle

parameterdescription.para: The angle we want our robot to turn to (in degrees)

detaileddescription.para: This method moves our robot through a tunnel by first finding the tunnel based on the lower left and upper right coordinates provided in GameParameters, aligning itself with the tunnel and then finally moving through it. the tunnel
This method moves our robot towards a ring set by noting ultrasonic sensor readings

parameterdescription.para: A RingSearcher object instance to detect ring colors and navigate around a ring set
A boolean that decides whether to correct our position when searching for a ring
A boolean that decides whether to rotate the rod motor to its original position

detaileddescription.para: This method rotates the robot by a certain angle

parameterdescription.para: The angle (in degrees) to rotate our robot to

detaileddescription.para: This method moves our robot forward

parameterdescription.para: An integer that denotes the speed to rotate our wheels at
A double that denotes the distance to travel

detaileddescription.para: This method stops both motors
This method converts directions our robot can face (up, down, right, left) into degrees

parameterdescription.para: The direction to convert

simplesect.para: The angle the robot should face in degrees

detaileddescription.para: This method moves the robot backwards until a black line is detected
This method moves the robot until a black line has been detected

parameterdescription.para: This boolean decides whether to check for a black line.

memberdef.argsstring: (ArrayList< int[]> points, int n, int multiplier)
memberdef.name: travelToTunnelEntrance

detaileddescription.para: This method navigates our robot to the entrance of a tunnel

parameterdescription.para: An ArrayList of points to navigate our robot to the tunnel entrance
An integer index to modify the list of points at
An integer to add onto each point

detaileddescription.para: This method converts a distance to the total number of wheel rotations needed to cover that distance.

parameterdescription.para: The radius of our wheels
The distance to travel

detaileddescription.para: This method converts an angle value to the number of wheel rotations needed to achieve rotation

parameterdescription.para: The radius of our wheels
The width
The angle to convert

detaileddescription.para: The Navigator class extends the functionality of the Navigation class. It offers an alternative travelTo() method which uses a state machine to implement obstacle avoidance.

The Navigator class does not override any of the methods in Navigation. All methods with the same name are overloaded i.e. the Navigator version takes different parameters than the Navigation version.

This is useful if, for instance, you want to force travel without obstacle detection over small distances. One place where you might want to do this is in the ObstacleAvoidance class. Another place is methods that implement specific features for future milestones such as retrieving an object.
